meanings.definition: The state or quality of being extremely angry or furious.
meanings.sent1: Her lividness was evident in the way she clenched her fists.
meanings.sent2: His lividness was so intense that he couldn't even speak.
meanings.sent3: Despite her lividness, she couldn't help but laugh at the absurdity of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The lividness in his eyes could have set the room on fire.
meanings.sent5: The lividness in her voice made everyone stop and listen.

meanings.sent1: The stormy sky had a hint of lividness as the clouds rolled in.
meanings.sent2: The old painting had faded to a dull lividness over the years.
meanings.sent3: The lividness of the ocean during the storm was both beautiful and ominous.
meanings.sent4: The lividness of the bruise on his arm was a stark reminder of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The lividness of the mountains against the evening sky was breathtaking.
